title: World Cup Qualifiers
body_text:

1 Posted 07/06/2025 at 15:48:32
Is he putting pressure on Pickford?
2 Posted 07/06/2025 at 16:38:58
That's the sort of thing coaches like Tuchel always say however he's come to England's rescue enough times while playing for us that Jordan's experience shot stopping for a poorer side than a European qualified one is beneficial.
I don't think there should be the same cachÃ© playing for a European qualified side these days given the recent Europa league final especially how many non- Champions are in the club tournaments.
3 Posted 07/06/2025 at 16:52:10
I find it unbelievable that Tuchel picked Jones in the squad and plays him at fullback today and 3 fullbacks in the squad?
4 Posted 07/06/2025 at 16:57:14
5 Posted 07/06/2025 at 17:43:24
It's just shite.
6 Posted 07/06/2025 at 17:49:23
7 Posted 07/06/2025 at 17:53:13
Oh, I know, it's England on telly... ðŸ˜€
8 Posted 07/06/2025 at 17:59:50
9 Posted 07/06/2025 at 18:02:14
Burn is shite.
James playing out of position.
Henderson is shite.
Palmer and Bellingham - brilliant players but prima donnas etcâ€¦.
Tuchel out!!!
10 Posted 07/06/2025 at 18:05:31
11 Posted 07/06/2025 at 18:07:58
12 Posted 07/06/2025 at 18:22:46
He's doing my head in with it.
13 Posted 07/06/2025 at 18:26:29
I watched the rugby final, a game played by men, real men, and I would have enjoyed it a bit more â€˜til Hull equalised with 2 minutes to go and won the game with the conversion.
I had a tenner on Warrington but felt sorry for the Warrington defender who made the mistake for Hull's try â€” he'll take a long time to forget that!
14 Posted 07/06/2025 at 18:26:35
15 Posted 07/06/2025 at 18:44:19
16 Posted 07/06/2025 at 18:46:01
If you want to watch a game played by men, watch the Munster hurling final now between Limerick and Cork â€” unbelievable.
17 Posted 07/06/2025 at 18:46:05
Manager, coaches and players should be embarrassed by this debacle.
18 Posted 07/06/2025 at 18:46:13
Then football comes on. ðŸ˜´
19 Posted 07/06/2025 at 18:53:25
20 Posted 07/06/2025 at 18:56:20
21 Posted 07/06/2025 at 19:02:14
USA vs Turkey later on... can't see it showing anywhere on UK TV.
Is it on Peacock, Mr Gaynes?
22 Posted 07/06/2025 at 19:08:20
I switched over for the football. I can only think of one word. Turgid.
Surely there could be a filter system for there to avoid matches like this? A bit like the FA Cup qualifying rounds.
They (England) play Senegal next week. At least we get to see Gana and Ndiaye.
23 Posted 07/06/2025 at 19:16:27
His left ear sticks out at a weird angle, much more acute â€” or is it obtuse? I always get those mixed up.
Anyway, I don't trust him.
24 Posted 07/06/2025 at 19:26:01
25 Posted 07/06/2025 at 19:28:34
Skinny legs, an obtuse ear and a comb over. Tuchel is probably an alien.
26 Posted 07/06/2025 at 19:32:47
Does he believe that Dean Henderson (2 caps) will be good enough to dislodge Jordan (75 caps) by playing in the Europa League?
Can't imagine previous world class England goalkeepers such as Banks and Shilton being treated in such an ignorant manner.
Thankfully I only endured the last 35 minutesof today's match. Evidently another dismal managerial appointment.
27 Posted 07/06/2025 at 19:59:57
28 Posted 07/06/2025 at 20:05:10
I was never fussy on the hurling games â€” those sticks get in the way! Give me a Gaelic football game and I'll watch it all day long, although I'm glad Seamus turned his back on that and joined us instead.
29 Posted 07/06/2025 at 20:20:07
Gollum lookalike even said his goalkeepers need to play in Europe â€“ not thinking that none of his selected keepers are in Europe.
Complete dope and awful performance.
30 Posted 07/06/2025 at 20:41:15
Venue: Pratt & Whitney Stadium at Rentschler Field, Hartford, Connecticut.
No Cenk Tosun for Turkey (Shame!) but this kid Alladin is playing No 20 â€” Oguz Aydin, winger at FenerbahÃ§e â€” linked with Everton!
31 Posted 07/06/2025 at 20:46:41
A brilliant finish by Jack McGlynn.
32 Posted 07/06/2025 at 21:01:50
33 Posted 07/06/2025 at 21:05:48
34 Posted 07/06/2025 at 21:07:30
35 Posted 07/06/2025 at 21:10:18
Uh-oh, now 1-2, Turkey score again! Aydin likes to get forward, his shot deflected, I think, kneading to the goal.
36 Posted 09/06/2025 at 20:18:18
37 Posted 09/06/2025 at 20:29:51
When De Bruyne had to high-jump over the advertising hoardings, chasing to keep the ball in play, the replay shows a sly push in the back from the Wales defender.
38 Posted 09/06/2025 at 20:39:10
39 Posted 09/06/2025 at 20:45:46
But having ex-kopite Bellamy as manager really puts me off. Someone who attacked a teammate with a golf club, left a youth coaching job due to bullying allegations, was cautioned by police for common assault on a female, and has been charged or convicted for numerous other offences.
A horrible person.
40 Posted 09/06/2025 at 20:48:46
Love to see Wales make a fist of this.
41 Posted 09/06/2025 at 20:57:16
42 Posted 09/06/2025 at 20:59:34
My abiding memory of Craig Bellamy was when he refused to shake hands with John Terry in support of his teammate Wayne Bridge.
43 Posted 09/06/2025 at 21:00:37
44 Posted 09/06/2025 at 21:02:08
45 Posted 09/06/2025 at 21:18:41
46 Posted 09/06/2025 at 21:21:09
47 Posted 09/06/2025 at 21:21:32
Flat track bullies reeling.
Who'd have thought that?
Come on the Taffs!
48 Posted 09/06/2025 at 21:24:29
49 Posted 09/06/2025 at 21:30:09
50 Posted 09/06/2025 at 21:30:23
51 Posted 09/06/2025 at 21:32:20
52 Posted 09/06/2025 at 21:34:33
53 Posted 09/06/2025 at 21:34:38
54 Posted 09/06/2025 at 21:37:13
De Bruyne makes it 4-3.
55 Posted 09/06/2025 at 21:52:58
I wasn't expecting that after 35 minutes.
56 Posted 09/06/2025 at 21:53:21
De Bruyne still has it. And that Duko is someone who terrifies defenders.
I always wonder, what language do the Belgium players speak to each other? Dutch or French? Sorry, random thought.
57 Posted 09/06/2025 at 22:33:20
Desperately poor officiating all night, I thought.
58 Posted 09/06/2025 at 22:39:54
It makes you wonder why VAR isn't used for other decisions rather than just offsides, goals and penalties.
I still think Belgium overall deserved the win.
